meanings.sent1: I will be resending the email to make sure you receive it.
meanings.sent2: She is resending the package because it got lost in the mail.
meanings.sent3: The computer kept resending the same message, driving everyone crazy.
meanings.sent4: The echoes in the canyon sounded like nature was resending its own voice.
meanings.sent5: Resending the signal multiple times increased the chances of it being received.

meanings.definition: The act of sending something again.
meanings.sent1: The resending of the document was necessary to ensure its delivery.
meanings.sent2: After the resending of the invitation, more guests confirmed their attendance.
meanings.sent3: The resending of the letter made it seem like the post office was playing a prank.
meanings.sent4: The resending of the waves crashing against the shore created a calming rhythm.
meanings.sent5: The resending of the signal improved the communication between the two devices.
